intro: Justicia petterssonii, commonly known as the Petersen's glorybower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its vibrant blooms.
